definition: to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: In this paper, the application scope of ice-melting of tranmission lines by short-circuit current is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文中还探讨了短路电流融冰方案的适用范围。

sentences.english: Melting ice in Greenland threatens to raise sea levels.
sentences.chinese: 格陵兰岛的融冰已威胁着海水的上涨。

sentences.english: A numerical model is developed for an internal melt ice - on - coil thermal storage tank.
sentences.chinese: 介绍内融冰式蓄冰桶改进的数值计算模型。

sentences.english: The discharge performance between the external melt and partial charged internal melt is experimentally compared.
sentences.chinese: 外融冰与‘不完全冻结式’内融冰取冷性能比较实验。

sentences.english: The discharge performance between the external melt and partial charged internal melt is experimentally compared.
sentences.chinese: 外融冰与‘不完全冻结式’内融冰取冷性能比较实验。

sentences.english: Which is why we use it on roads, right?
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们在路上用盐融冰的原因？

sentences.english: Scientists for the Antarctica ice-melting situation, worried.
sentences.chinese: 科学家对于南极洲融冰情况，感到忧心。

sentences.english: Sincere tears can melt ice and thaw snow.
sentences.chinese: 真诚的泪水能融冰化雪。

definition: to defrost/to get rid of ice
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
to freeze over (of water or land)
to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice-jam flood (arising when river downstream freezes more than upstream)
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
